arm_group.description: 3 capsules krill oil per day, for 28 days
9 capsules krill oil per day, for 28 days

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to examine whether 4 weeks daily intake of krill oil can change
      the omega-3 index (content of the long chained fatty acids EPA and DHA in relation to the
      total fatty acids) in the membrane in red blood cells. We investigate this at two different
      doses. Furthermore, the purpose of the study is also to examine the effect of the krill oil
      intake on plasma lipids (triacylglycerol, phospholipids and cholesterol), plasma fatty acid
      composition, as well as product tolerance in healthy, young individuals.

clinical_study.brief_title: Krill Oil as Supplementation to Healthy Young Adults.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Healthy young adults

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Disease/illness

          -  Not able to swallow supplements in capsule form

          -  Not willing to take blood samples

facility.name: Department of Clinical Science, University of Bergen

clinical_study.official_title: Study of the Effect of Krill Oil Supplement on Omega-3 Fatty Acid Index and Tolerance

oversight_info.authority: Norway:National Committee for Medical and Health Research Ethics

primary_outcome.description: Change in fatty acid composition and omega-3 index (sum of % EPA and DHA)
primary_outcome.measure: Fatty acid composition in red blood cells (the membrane)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description:
Change in triacylglycerol levels.
Change in phospholipid levels.
Change in cholesterol levels (total, ester, free, HDL, LDL).
Change in fatty acid composition and omega-3 index (sum of % EPA and DHA).
Change in fasting glucose and glucose tolerance.

secondary_outcome.measure: Tolerance of and compliance with intervention

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Supportive Care
